title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 21.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21:1, who did the LORD speak to about the priests?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:1 states that the LORD said unto Moses to speak unto the priests.

questions.question: Who among the following is a priest allowed to be defiled for when mourning, according to Leviticus 21:2?
questions.correctAnswer: His mother
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:2 specifies that priests may be defiled for his kin such as his mother, father, son, daughter, and brother.

questions.question: What condition is mentioned in Leviticus 21:3 for a priest to be defiled for his sister?
questions.correctAnswer: She must be a virgin
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:3 states that a priest may be defiled for his sister if she is a virgin and has had no husband.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21:5, which of the following is forbidden for priests to do?
questions.correctAnswer: Make baldness upon their head
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:5 forbids priests from making baldness upon their head, shaving the corner of their beard, or making cuttings in their flesh.

questions.question: What is the reason priests must be holy according to Leviticus 21:6?
options: Because they offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire
questions.correctAnswer: Because they offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6 states priests shall be holy because they offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire and the bread of their God.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21:7, what kind of woman shall a priest not take as a wife?
questions.correctAnswer: A whore or profane woman
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:7 forbids priests from taking a wife that is a whore or profane, or a woman put away from her husband.

questions.question: What punishment is prescribed in Leviticus 21:9 for a priest's daughter who profanes herself by playing the whore?
options: She shall be burnt with fire
questions.correctAnswer: She shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:9 states that the daughter of any priest who profanes herself by playing the whore shall be burnt with fire.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21:10, what must the high priest not do?
questions.correctAnswer: Uncover his head
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:10 commands that the high priest shall not uncover his head nor rend his clothes.

questions.question: Leviticus 21:11 states the high priest shall not defile himself for whom?
questions.correctAnswer: His father or mother
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:11 says the high priest shall not go in to any dead body nor defile himself for his father or mother.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 21:13, the high priest shall take a wife who is a virgin.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:13 explicitly states the high priest shall take a wife in her virginity.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 21:14 allows the high priest to marry a widow or a divorced woman.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:14 forbids the high priest from taking a widow, divorced woman, profane, or harlot as a wife.

questions.question: Who shall not approach to offer the bread of God according to Leviticus 21:17?
options: Anyone who is not a priest
questions.correctAnswer: Anyone with a blemish
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:17 commands that any of Aaron’s seed with any blemish shall not approach to offer the bread of his God.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a blemish in Leviticus 21:18-20?
questions.correctAnswer: Being tall
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:18-20 lists various blemishes but does not mention being tall as one.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 21:23, a man with a blemish can go in unto the vail and come near the altar.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:23 states a man with a blemish shall not go in unto the vail nor come near the altar to avoid profaning sanctuaries.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Leviticus 21:22: 'He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the ____.'
questions.correctAnswer: holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:22 says he shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy and of the holy.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 21 teach us about honoring family relationships in times of mourning?
options: Priests may only be defiled for the death of close relatives like parents and siblings
Priests must never mourn for anyone
Priests can mourn for any person in their community
Priests must mourn publicly for all the dead
questions.correctAnswer: Priests may only be defiled for the death of close relatives like parents and siblings
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:1-3 instructs that priests should not be defiled for the dead except for certain close relatives such as mother, father, son, daughter, brother, and an unmarried sister, showing respect for family bonds.

questions.question: What principle about holiness and personal conduct can we learn from the instruction to priests not to make baldness or cuttings on their bodies?
options: They must maintain physical holiness without signs of mourning
They should follow all cultural hairstyles
They are allowed to mark their bodies as they please
They must grow long hair and beards
questions.correctAnswer: They must maintain physical holiness without signs of mourning
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:5 forbids priests from making bald spots or cutting their flesh, teaching that they must remain holy and not profane themselves by outward signs of grief or defilement.

questions.question: Based on Leviticus 21, how should a believer approach marriage in order to honor holiness?
options: Priests should marry a virgin from their own people
Priests can marry divorced or profane women
Priests may marry anyone they choose
Marriage is not important for priests
questions.correctAnswer: Priests should marry a virgin from their own people
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14 emphasize that the high priest must marry a virgin of his own people and not a widow, divorced, or profane woman, underscoring the value of purity and holiness in marriage.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with maintaining integrity in their role at church. What does Leviticus 21 teach about the importance of holiness in service to God?
options: Those who serve God must be holy and not profane His name
Service to God allows for some personal failings
Holiness is only required in private life
God accepts any offering regardless of the person's conduct
questions.correctAnswer: Those who serve God must be holy and not profane His name
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6-8 instructs priests to be holy unto God and not profane His name, as they offer the offerings of the LORD, highlighting the call for integrity and holiness in ministry.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 21 address the issue of physical imperfections in those serving as priests, and what spiritual principle can we learn?
options: Priests with blemishes may eat holy bread but cannot offer sacrifices or enter the sanctuary
All priests, regardless of imperfections, can perform sacrifices
Physical perfection is unimportant in service
Only the high priest must be without blemish
questions.correctAnswer: Priests with blemishes may eat holy bread but cannot offer sacrifices or enter the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Verses 17-23 specify that priests with physical blemishes cannot offer the bread of God or enter the sanctuary but may eat the holy bread, teaching respect for God’s holiness while showing inclusion in other ways.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 21 teach about the consequences of profaning one’s self or family in the context of priestly service?
options: The daughter of a priest who profanes herself shall be burned with fire
There are no consequences for profaning oneself
Only the priest is punished, not their family
questions.correctAnswer: The daughter of a priest who profanes herself shall be burned with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:9 states that the daughter of any priest who profanes herself by playing the whore profanes her father and shall be burned with fire, emphasizing the seriousness of maintaining holiness.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 21, a high priest is allowed to mourn and defile himself for his parents.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:10-11 states the high priest shall not uncover his head nor defile himself for his father or mother, showing the importance of maintaining holiness despite personal loss.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 21 commands that priests should not marry women who have been divorced or are prostitutes.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:7 and 14 clearly forbid priests and the high priest from marrying women who are prostitutes, divorced, or profane, reinforcing the call to holiness in marriage.

questions.question: When a believer is facing temptation to dishonor their family name, what guidance does Leviticus 21 provide through the example of the priesthood?
options: One must keep themselves holy and avoid profaning their family
Family honor is not important in personal conduct
Temptation is excusable in difficult times
Only religious leaders need to maintain holiness
questions.correctAnswer: One must keep themselves holy and avoid profaning their family
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6-9 shows that priests must not profane themselves or their family’s name, as seen in the punishment for the daughter who profanes herself, teaching the importance of holiness for all believers.

questions.question: A believer struggles with physical limitations and feels unworthy to serve God. Based on Leviticus 21, what biblical truth could encourage them?
options: Though some with blemishes cannot offer sacrifices, they may still partake of holy food and be part of God’s people
Physical limitations mean God rejects their service entirely
Only perfect people can be part of the community
Physical conditions have no impact on spiritual roles
questions.correctAnswer: Though some with blemishes cannot offer sacrifices, they may still partake of holy food and be part of God’s people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:22 explains that priests with blemishes may eat the bread of God, both most holy and holy, showing inclusion and value despite physical imperfections.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 21 guide believers in dealing with spiritual discipline and personal holiness in everyday work and service?
options: Believers must maintain holiness and not profane God's name in their service
Holiness is only necessary during worship services
Work and service do not require spiritual discipline
Personal holiness is a private matter unrelated to work
questions.correctAnswer: Believers must maintain holiness and not profane God's name in their service
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6-8 emphasizes that those offering the Lord’s offerings must be holy and not profane the name of God, teaching that holiness applies to all service and work.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The LORD said to Moses that a priest shall not take a wife who is _______, but only a virgin of his own people.
options: a widow, or divorced, or profane
questions.correctAnswer: a widow, or divorced, or profane
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:14 clearly states the high priest must not marry a widow, divorced woman, or profane woman, but only a virgin of his own people, emphasizing purity and covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: What attitude toward God's sanctity and the priestly role can believers derive from the command that the high priest must not uncover his head or tear his clothes?
options: The high priest must maintain dignity and not show typical signs of mourning
The high priest can mourn like anyone else
The high priest should express grief loudly
Mourning is forbidden for all believers
questions.correctAnswer: The high priest must maintain dignity and not show typical signs of mourning
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:10 commands the high priest not to uncover his head or rend his clothes, indicating the importance of maintaining holiness and dignity in his role.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21, what is a practical way believers can honor God in their family and community relationships?
options: By living holy lives and avoiding actions that profane God’s name
By focusing only on personal success
questions.correctAnswer: By living holy lives and avoiding actions that profane God’s name
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6-9 stresses holiness and warns against profaning God’s name through immoral actions, guiding believers to live in a way that honors God in family and community.

questions.question: How does the instruction that priests with blemishes cannot offer sacrifices but may eat holy bread teach us about God’s holiness and mercy?
options: God demands holiness in service but still includes imperfect people in His provision
God excludes all imperfect people entirely
Only perfect people receive God’s provision
God’s holiness means no one can approach Him
questions.correctAnswer: God demands holiness in service but still includes imperfect people in His provision
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:21-22 shows that while blemished priests cannot offer sacrifices, they may share in holy food, demonstrating God's holiness alongside His mercy and inclusion.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 21 teach about the relationship between obedience and sanctification in the life of a believer serving God?
options: Obedience to God's commands leads to sanctification and holiness
Sanctification happens without regard to obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commands leads to sanctification and holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:8 states the LORD sanctifies the priests and calls them to be holy, implying that obedience to God's commands results in sanctification for those who serve Him.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 21.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21:1-3, which relatives of a priest may he become defiled for by contact with their dead?
options: Mother, father, son, daughter, brother, and virgin sister
questions.correctAnswer: Mother, father, son, daughter, brother, and virgin sister
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:2-3 specifies that priests may be defiled for their close kin: mother, father, son, daughter, brother, and virgin sister, but not for others among the people.

questions.question: What is forbidden for priests in Leviticus 21:5 as a sign of mourning or grief?
options: Making baldness on their head, shaving the beard's corners, or making cuttings in the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Making baldness on their head, shaving the beard's corners, or making cuttings in the flesh
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:5 forbids priests from making baldness on their head, shaving off corners of their beards, or making cuttings in their flesh, which were common mourning customs in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: Why must priests be holy according to Leviticus 21:6?
options: Because they offer the LORD's offerings by fire and the bread of their God
Because they live separately from the community
Because they must wear special garments
questions.correctAnswer: Because they offer the LORD's offerings by fire and the bread of their God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6 explains that priests must be holy because they offer the LORD's offerings by fire and the bread of their God, emphasizing their sacred role in worship.

questions.question: Leviticus 21:7 forbids priests from marrying which types of women?
options: A prostitute, a profane woman, or a divorced woman
A woman who is a prophetess
questions.correctAnswer: A prostitute, a profane woman, or a divorced woman
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:7 forbids priests from marrying a prostitute, a profane woman, or a divorced woman, to maintain their holiness and sanctity.

questions.question: What is the penalty for a priest's daughter who profanes herself by playing the whore, according to Leviticus 21:9?
options: She shall be burnt with fire
questions.correctAnswer: She shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:9 states that the daughter of a priest who profanes herself by playing the whore shall be burnt with fire, indicating the severe penalty for defiling the priestly family.

questions.question: What specific restrictions apply to the high priest concerning contact with the dead, as indicated in Leviticus 21:10-11?
options: He shall not uncover his head, rend his clothes, nor defile himself for his parents
He may defile himself only for his parents
He can defile himself for any relative
He must always defile himself before offering sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not uncover his head, rend his clothes, nor defile himself for his parents
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:10-11 states the high priest must not uncover his head or rend his clothes, nor defile himself even for his father or mother, highlighting his unique sanctity.

questions.question: What type of wife is the high priest required to take, according to Leviticus 21:13-14?
options: A virgin of his own people
questions.correctAnswer: A virgin of his own people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:13-14 instructs the high priest to marry a virgin of his own people, excluding widows, divorced women, and profane women to preserve the holiness of the priesthood.

questions.question: Which of the following physical blemishes disqualify a priest from offering the bread of God, according to Leviticus 21:17-21?
options: Blindness, lameness, flat nose, broken foot or hand, crooked back, dwarfism, eye blemish, scurvy, scab, or broken stones
questions.correctAnswer: Blindness, lameness, flat nose, broken foot or hand, crooked back, dwarfism, eye blemish, scurvy, scab, or broken stones
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:17-21 lists numerous physical defects that disqualify a priest from offering sacrifices, emphasizing ritual purity and perfection in the priesthood.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 21:22 address priests with blemishes concerning their participation in eating the bread of God?
options: They may eat the bread of God, both of the most holy and of the holy
They are forbidden from eating any sacred bread
They may only eat outside the sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: They may eat the bread of God, both of the most holy and of the holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:22 permits priests with blemishes to eat the bread of God, both the most holy and the holy, but restricts their service at the altar.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21:23, why must a priest with a blemish not enter the veil or come near the altar?
options: Because he would profane the sanctuaries
Because he is not strong enough
Because he is not from Aaron's seed
questions.correctAnswer: Because he would profane the sanctuaries
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:23 explains that a priest with a blemish must not enter the veil or approach the altar to avoid profaning the sanctuaries, highlighting the importance of holiness.

questions.question: Leviticus 21:8 contains the phrase 'I the LORD, which sanctify you, am holy.' How does this statement serve as a theological foundation for the priestly holiness laws?
options: It establishes that the priests' holiness derives from God's own holiness
It indicates that priests are holy by their own merit
It suggests priests can become holy through sacrifices alone
It emphasizes the priests' separation from the people
questions.correctAnswer: It establishes that the priests' holiness derives from God's own holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:8 underlines that the holiness required of priests is grounded in the holiness of God Himself, indicating a divine standard and source of sanctification.

questions.question: In the cultural context of the ancient Near East, why might priests have been forbidden from shaving the corners of their beards or making cuttings in their flesh, as stated in Leviticus 21:5?
options: These were pagan mourning rites associated with idolatry
Because they were signs of wealth
Because they made priests look like commoners
questions.correctAnswer: These were pagan mourning rites associated with idolatry
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:5 forbids such practices as they were common mourning customs linked to pagan rituals, which priests had to avoid to maintain ritual purity and distinction from other cultures.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 21:11-12, the high priest must leave the sanctuary to mourn for his parents if they die.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:11-12 states that the high priest shall not go in to any dead body nor defile himself for his father or mother, nor go out of the sanctuary, emphasizing his continuous sacred service.

questions.question: How does the restriction in Leviticus 21:15 about not profaning his seed among his people relate to the broader biblical theme of holiness and purity?
options: It emphasizes the importance of the priestly lineage remaining undefiled to reflect God's holiness
It refers to not having children outside marriage
It mandates priests to have many children
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the importance of the priestly lineage remaining undefiled to reflect God's holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:15 highlights that the priest must not profane his descendants, aligning with the biblical theme that holiness must permeate the priestly line as a reflection of God's own holiness.

questions.question: Leviticus 21:24 records Moses informing Aaron and his sons of these laws. What does this suggest about the legal and communal transmission of priestly regulations in ancient Israel?
options: Priestly laws were publicly communicated to ensure communal adherence and awareness
Laws were kept secret among priests
These laws were written but not spoken aloud
questions.correctAnswer: Priestly laws were publicly communicated to ensure communal adherence and awareness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:24 shows Moses telling Aaron, his sons, and all Israel, indicating that priestly laws were transmitted openly to maintain order and holiness within the community.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21, who among the following may a priest become ceremonially defiled for due to death?
questions.correctAnswer: His father
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:2 explicitly states that a priest may be defiled for his close kin such as father, mother, son, daughter, brother, and a virgin sister. This restriction highlights the call to holiness, consistent with the call for God's people to be separate (Leviticus 21:1-3, Numbers 19:11, Ezekiel 44:25, Hebrews 7:26).

questions.question: What is forbidden for priests to do as a sign of mourning, according to Leviticus 21?
questions.correctAnswer: Make baldness upon their head
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:5 forbids priests from making baldness upon their heads, shaving the corners of their beards, or making cuttings in their flesh. This command preserves the sanctity of priests, paralleling the call to holiness in Leviticus 10:6-7 and the New Testament's emphasis on holy living (1 Peter 1:16).

questions.question: What type of woman is a priest expressly forbidden to marry, according to Leviticus 21?
questions.correctAnswer: A divorced woman
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:7, 14 forbids priests from marrying a prostitute, a divorced woman, or a profane woman, emphasizing the holiness required of the priesthood. This aligns with the priestly purity theme, echoed in 2 Corinthians 6:14-16 and Ephesians 5:25-27.

questions.question: Which of the following is a consequence for the daughter of a priest who profanes herself by playing the whore?
options: She shall be burnt with fire
She shall be made a servant
questions.correctAnswer: She shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:9 prescribes that the daughter of a priest who defiles herself by prostitution shall be burnt with fire. This severe penalty underscores the seriousness of maintaining holiness in the priestly family, consistent with the Old Testament's strict purity laws (Deuteronomy 22:21, Ezekiel 44:22, Revelation 21:27).

questions.question: What is forbidden for the high priest when anointed with the oil, according to Leviticus 21?
options: He shall not uncover his head
He shall not eat unclean food
He shall not leave the city
He shall not speak to common people
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not uncover his head
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:10 commands that the high priest shall not uncover his head nor rend his clothes, showing reverence and sanctity in his office. This sanctification is echoed in Psalm 133:2 and the New Testament high priestly role of Christ (Hebrews 7:26).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 21, what must the high priest avoid to not profane the sanctuary of God?
options: Going in to any dead body
questions.correctAnswer: Going in to any dead body
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:11 forbids the high priest from entering any dead body or defiling himself for his parents, preserving the sanctity of the sanctuary. This requirement is consistent with holiness codes (Numbers 19:11, Ezekiel 44:25) and the purity of Christ as our High Priest (Hebrews 9:11-14).

questions.question: Who is the LORD identifying as holy and sanctifying in Leviticus 21?
questions.correctAnswer: The priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:8 declares that the LORD sanctifies the priests because they offer the bread of God, setting them apart as holy, which aligns with the broader biblical theme of God's holiness and His people being set apart (Exodus 19:6, 1 Peter 2:9, Hebrews 5:1).

questions.question: Which physical condition disqualifies a man of Aaron's seed from offering the bread of God, according to Leviticus 21?
questions.correctAnswer: Being blind
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:18 lists blindness among the blemishes disqualifying a priest from offering sacrifices, emphasizing the need for physical perfection in those serving at the altar, reflecting God's perfection (Matthew 5:48, James 1:17) and the sinlessness required in Christ as our perfect High Priest (Hebrews 4:15).

questions.question: What is the status of a priest with a blemish regarding eating the bread of God?
options: He shall eat both of the most holy and of the holy
He shall not eat any holy bread
He shall only eat common food
He shall eat outside the sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: He shall eat both of the most holy and of the holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:22 states that a priest with a blemish may still eat the bread of God, both of the most holy and holy, but shall not offer sacrifices. This distinction highlights the balance between holiness and grace, similar to New Testament themes of acceptance despite imperfection (Romans 8:1, 1 Corinthians 1:27).

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a blemish that disqualifies a priest from offering sacrifices in Leviticus 21?
questions.correctAnswer: A lost tooth
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:18-20 details many physical blemishes that disqualify a priest, including dwarfism, broken hand, and scabbed skin, but does not mention a lost tooth. This distinction shows the specificity of biblical purity laws, reflecting God's holiness (Isaiah 6:3, 1 Peter 1:16).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 21 teach about the sanctity of priestly seed?
options: They shall not profane their seed among their people
They shall offer sacrifices for their children
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not profane their seed among their people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:15 forbids priests from profaning their seed, emphasizing the importance of holiness in lineage, a theme consistent with the covenant promises to Abraham’s seed (Genesis 17:7, Malachi 2:15, Hebrews 7:14).

questions.question: What is the LORD's reason for commanding priests to be holy in Leviticus 21?
options: Because they offer the bread of God
Because they are rulers of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Because they offer the bread of God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:6 explains that priests must be holy because they offer the offerings of the LORD and the bread of God, reflecting the reverence due to God's representatives, linking to Christ's role as the perfect offering (Hebrews 10:5-7, 1 Corinthians 11:27).

questions.question: Who did Moses convey the commandments of Leviticus 21 to, according to verse 24?
options: Aaron and his sons and all the children of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons and all the children of Israel
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:24 states Moses told Aaron, his sons, and all Israel, showing the communal importance of priestly holiness, consistent with the corporate nature of covenant in the Old Testament (Exodus 19:5-6, Deuteronomy 29:10-12, Hebrews 3:5-6).

questions.question: What is the significance of the anointing oil upon the high priest as explained in Leviticus 21?
options: It is the crown of the anointing oil of his God
It grants him power to rule the people
questions.correctAnswer: It is the crown of the anointing oil of his God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:12 describes the anointing oil as a crown upon the high priest, symbolizing God's sanctification and authority, prefiguring the eternal priesthood of Christ anointed by God (Psalm 45:7, Hebrews 1:9, Isaiah 61:1).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 21 teach about the holiness of God in relation to the sanctification of priests?
options: I the LORD, which sanctify you, am holy
God is merciful but not holy
questions.correctAnswer: I the LORD, which sanctify you, am holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 21:8 states that the LORD who sanctifies the priests is Himself holy, underlining the doctrine that God's holiness is the foundation for the holiness required of His people (Isaiah 6:3, 1 Peter 1:16, Revelation 4:8).
